Hi Sean, could you please help understand why the py37 job has gone?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-05-04 21:56:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Hi Sean, could you please help understand why the py37 job has
 > gone?

The required runtimes for Victoria are py36 and py38. 3.7 is still covered by some integration tests, and it is assumed that the coverage span between 36 and 38 will make it very unlikely that there will be a compatibility issue with 37.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-05-04 22:03:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-05-04 22:04:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thank you, Sean.'}]

commit_message:
Add py38 package metadata

Now that we are running the Victoria tests that include a
voting py38, we can now add the Python 3.8 metadata to the
package information to reflect that support.

Change-Id: Id12970d7cf493564ea0ceb339b8e429bf031ce95
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-04-03 06:51:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add ssh timeout for baremetal_deploy

Mistakingly and historically
tripleo.baremetal_deploy.v1.deploy_instances used to pass its
timeout input into ansible connection timeout instead of
global/deployment timeout.

To pertain the established tradition for setting connection timeout to
some timeout, add missing input for ansible connection timeout and give
it some reasonable value.

The use of the timeout input to be passed into the real deployment
timeout parameter is fixed in the scope of the related bug.

commit_message:
[Train only] Add ssh timeout for baremetal_deploy

Mistakingly and historically
tripleo.baremetal_deploy.v1.deploy_instances used to pass its
timeout input into ansible connection timeout instead of
global/deployment timeout.

To pertain the established tradition for setting connection timeout to
some timeout, add missing input for ansible connection timeout and give
it some reasonable value.

The use of the timeout input to be passed into the real deployment
timeout parameter is fixed in the scope of the related bug.

Related-Bug: #1868063

Change-Id: I7d2fce9f07c98b1770c01cacbae2d17b8e143b3b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Set cache parameter for openidc in tht

This patch migrates hieradata definition about cahe usage in openidc
integration from puppet-tripleo to tripleo-heat-templates, so that we
can implement a new parameter to disable caching with memcache in tht.

Change-Id: Id791ea923ce15208fca69ccdc7faa5f0bdbfcf2a

rebased.

With respect to being huge - agree, but it doesn't work to be done in smaller batches, due to all the dependencies everywhere. You touch one thing - and immediately the whole net of deps is affected. including multi-part upload using Swift. This is simply not possible
with stdin. On the other hand we can't do md5 verification of the upload
- validate functional tests are working
- enjoy improved performance of the relevant calls
- think on how to educate SDK to unset properties efficiently
- Add tests for the get_data_file function

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682454/
Change-Id: I36f292fb70c98f6e558f58be55d533d979c47ca7

commit_message:
Switch image to use SDK

This is a work to switch OSC from using glanceclient to OpenStackSDK.

With this change only v2 is using OpenStackSDK. V1 is still using
glanceclient and will be switched in a separate change.

Remove the direct depend on keystoneauth- let that flow through
openstacksdk.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/698972
Change-Id: I36f292fb70c98f6e558f58be55d533d979c47ca7

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: Ie841dc9738ed029ef01add3681ed76112e2cdca3
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add py38 package metadata

Now that we are running the Victoria tests that include a
voting py38, we can now add the Python 3.8 metadata to the
package information to reflect that support.

Change-Id: I212f8027055ebeeb3dc3948426ede6a704c719ff
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: [k8s] Fix docker storage of Fedora CoreOS
messages:
[{'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-08 02:29:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-15 08:41:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-16 00:14:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-16 00:25:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-16 00:31:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-16 00:33:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

e.g. Why do we not  support devicemapper in coreos for example?'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-16 01:25:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-16 02:19:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-17 09:53:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

As a follow up patch, we should address the fact that devicemapper is still our default docker_storage_driver. We should change this to overlay2.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-17 10:02:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-17 10:03:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

That's a good point. I will add a follow up patch change the default docker storage driver."}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-04-17 10:14:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> That's a good point. I will add a follow up patch change the
 > default docker storage driver.

-1 
Can we define a policy for changing defaults? One release deprecaration minimum for example?"}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-17 10:24:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

You mean top level options right? Not label options?'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-04-17 10:32:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> You mean top level options right? Not label options?

All user and operator facing options. API or config file.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-17 10:45:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-17 10:47:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> > You mean top level options right? Not label options?
 > 
 > All user and operator facing options. API or config file.

Could you clarify if that includes labels or not, since technically labels are user facing.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-04-17 11:14:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> > > You mean top level options right? Not label options?
 > >
 > > All user and operator facing options. API or config file.
 > 
 > Could you clarify if that includes labels or not, since technically
 > labels are user facing.

I meant labels too. Labels are exposed via the API. I understand that the storage driver as an option (label or field) it doesn't matter much anymore and overlay2 is the obvious default now, and I agree. It would be better if we had policy for the defaults.

Also, we don't have to do it if we decide to be very "loud" in the release notes. like: danger danger, something changed and action is required.

So as you want team. Our policy can be a very clrear message in the relreasenotes instead of the deprecation policy. Plus be able to let ops/users maintain the previous behaviour.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-19 23:56:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

So are you guys suggesting we should support devicemapper for fedora coreOS in this patch?'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-22 05:45:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The default docker version in fedora coreos 31(Fedora CoreOS 31.20200223.3.0) is v18.09.8. And the devicemapper has been deprecated in docker v18.09, see https://docs.docker.com/engine/deprecated/#device-mapper-storage-driver

So I don't think it's reasonable to add the devicemapper support in this patch.

As for the deprecation note of default docker storage driver, we should add a release note and a warning in log in a separate patch, but change it in Victora cycle. @Spyros, @Bharat, thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-22 06:47:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I‚Äôm happy with that'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-23 02:02:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

The deprecation note patch is tracked by https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722163/'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-23 21:57:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

https://docs.docker.com/storage/storagedriver/overlayfs-driver/#configure-docker-with-the-overlay-or-overlay2-storage-driver says the storage driver type needs to be written to /etc/docker/daemon.json. I know the default is overlay2 for parity with atomic, we should at least allow user to choose overlay :) thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-23 21:57:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

otherwise the docker_storage_driver var basically has no effect here.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-23 21:58:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Besides the point above, the patch generally works.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-24 07:03:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Docker does support other storage drivers though magnum doesn't support them yet. By default, there is no /etc/docker/daemon.json, are you suggesting create one? If we have decided not support overlay and devicemapper, I can't see why we have to go further on that way."}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-24 07:44:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Ok let‚Äôs just mention in the docs that for fedora coreos driver, docker_storage_driver is ignored and overlay2 (docker default) is used'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-24 08:14:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Let's see Spyros thoughts."}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-27 14:44:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

ping Spyros'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-04-27 15:22:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-27 21:07:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-27 21:48:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I would opt for only allowing overlay2 on fcos heat template as the current code only allows for that'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-28 01:32:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi Bharat, do you mean at https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/drivers/k8s_fedora_coreos_v1/templates/kubecluster.yaml#L272

replacing the default value and adding the below constraint?

constraints:
 - allowed_values: ["overlay2"]'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-28 05:35:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Yes that‚Äôs correct and also update the docs to reflect this constraint for fcos :) thank you.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-28 06:16:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-28 07:00:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-04-28 07:58:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-28 08:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-28 08:23:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-04-28 08:29:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-04-28 09:15:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-04-28 09:16:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-04-28 11:10:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-28 22:04:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-28 22:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

So the current situation is a user asks for a docker storage driver that is not devicemapper and they get overlay2 silently. Is this the end behaviour we want? I would prefer to see an error if a driver is not supported at all (or in this case, there is clearly only one supported driver which is overlay2'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-28 22:15:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Am I missing something obvious here?'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-28 22:17:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@Bharat, did you see this https://github.com/openstack/magnum/commit/28fff8006ae17d9afeee4ad409e12b6608fa26cb'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-28 22:30:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

@Bharat, I understand your concern but as Spyros said if we just limited the option to 'overlay2' that said, users can't change to any other driver which compatible with overlay2, without changing the source code.

Thought your question does make sense, but allowing input any string as the driver is the current behaviour. Let's don't break it before we having a better solution. Does this make sense for you?"}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-29 21:49:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-29 21:51:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-29 22:35:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
[k8s] Fix docker storage of Fedora CoreOS

In commit I1a75f1bf12747508a3497293650d3cc668202de6 the worker node
is missed to add the docker storage support. And the current systemd
unit is not really working. So this patch fixes it by removing the
hardcode for /dev/vdb and using xfs instead of ext4 (the same way
for Fedora Atomic) to make it simpler and solid.

Task: 39331
Story: 2005201

Change-Id: I4c465664eb19f1992df95750dd7b2d99688c6cae

messages:
[{'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2020-05-02 02:04:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2020-05-04 07:51:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

the problem here is that the versioning of the unreleased tarballs for the clients is messed up. 

better backport the patches. I think I was doing that already.'}, {'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2020-05-04 14:03:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

How is the version messed up? 3.13.2~dev2 is the resulting version and seems to be correct.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2020-05-04 14:49:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

ah, so this is a positive change then. we used to have (oldrev) before, aka we'd have 3.13.0.XXX which was then smaller than the released version 3.13.1 here. 

I'm fine with switching to tracking stable branch then after em."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2020-05-04 15:52:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

I think this still isn't such a good idea. in extended maintenance phase there won't be new releases:

https://releases.openstack.org/

which means we might not actually find a lot of people interested in backporting patches upstream so that the tracking of the -stable- tarball will pick it up. also, when unmaintained happens on pike, you have to change back to patches anyway.

so I suggest to cherry-pick the patches as individual patches instead. that should make things simpler."}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2020-05-04 16:01:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I think this still isn't such a good idea. in extended maintenance
 > phase there won't be new releases:
 > 
 > https://releases.openstack.org/
 > 
 > which means we might not actually find a lot of people interested
 > in backporting patches upstream so that the tracking of the
 > -stable- tarball will pick it up. also, when unmaintained happens
 > on pike, you have to change back to patches anyway.
 > 
 > so I suggest to cherry-pick the patches as individual patches
 > instead. that should make things simpler.

I am fine with that as well. The downside is that we may ended up carrying multiple patches. I would imagine that at this point the only backports in Pike would be critical fixes, which we want anyway?"}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2020-05-04 21:49:38.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

in favor of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/725408/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-02 02:04:46.000000000', 'message': 'python-keystoneclient: track stable-pike tarballs

Since upstream policy allows continuation of releasing tarballs for
the Pike branch and the current em version is effectively broken, we
should track the latest tarball release in order to benefit from the latest
backports.

Change-Id: I74d893b6befd5d40e7c7a3fe94e87627b70eb0e7
'}]
commit_message:
python-keystoneclient: track stable-pike tarballs

Since upstream policy allows continuation of releasing tarballs for
the Pike branch and the current em version is effectively broken, we
should track the latest tarball release in order to benefit from the latest
backports.

Change-Id: I74d893b6befd5d40e7c7a3fe94e87627b70eb0e7

Update docs building, cleanup after py27 removal a bit:
* Update requirements for Sphinx and openstackdocstheme for
  python 3
* Remove unneeded sections from setup.cfg
* Remove install_command, it's unneeded, the default is fine.
* Move constraints into deps, use TOX_CONSTRAINTS instead of obsolete

"}]
commit_message:
Update docs building, py27 cleanup

Update docs building, cleanup after py27 removal a bit:
* Update requirements for Sphinx and openstackdocstheme for
  python 3
* Remove unneeded sections from setup.cfg
* Remove install_command, it's unneeded, the default is fine.
* Move constraints into deps, use TOX_CONSTRAINTS instead of obsolete
  UPPER_CONSTRAINTS
* Switch to hacking 3.0, fix problems found

Change-Id: I8b5634b02b399a0678c611b7be8593280b666953

commit_message:
Set ctl socket ownership

This is moved from neutron-ovs-agent init script[0] to
openvswitch poststart to ensure that ovs ctl socket
has the required permissions even if the openvswitch
pods are restarted.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-helm/blob/master/neutron/templates/bin/_neutron-openvswitch-agent-init.sh.tpl#L22-L25

commit_message:
keystonemiddleware: track stable-pike tarballs

Since upstream policy allows continuation of releasing tarballs for
the Pike branch and the current em version is effectively broken, we
should track the latest tarball release in order to benefit from the latest
backports.

Change-Id: I8e88db775443cd7babf29aba8a372bb3d7a31285

[{'created': '2020-05-01 17:05:11.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for experimental Metricbeat service module

Metricbeat has recently added experimental support for service monitoring
as part of the system metricset:
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/beats/metricbeat/current/metricbeat-metricset-system-service.html
This commit enables this when metricbeat is deployed, so Metricbeat

commit_message:
Add support for experimental Metricbeat service module

Metricbeat has recently added experimental support for service monitoring
as part of the system metricset:
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/beats/metricbeat/current/metricbeat-metricset-system-service.html
This commit enables this when metricbeat is deployed, so Metricbeat
will now also collect service information.

Change-Id: Ia68f23f3a0e41fd3977af0a5252ce8109a798b03

Add script to help check for unused packages

This adds a script that will check through all the requirements in
global-requirements for any that are no longer being used.

Haproxy warns us with the following:
stderr F [WARNING] 121/195330 (7) : parsing [/etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg:116] : HTTP log/header format not usable with proxy 'nova_novncproxy' (needs 'mode http').
stderr F [WARNING] 121/195330 (7) : config : 'http-request' rules ignored for proxy 'nova_novncproxy' as they require HTTP mode.

Let's add mode http to avoid this.

Change-Id: Ib3daf19ed7318a0a04349b62ea4c821e1d87e648
"}, {'created': '2020-05-03 15:44:22.000000000', 'message': "Use http mode for nova_novncproxy

Haproxy warns us with the following:
stderr F [WARNING] 121/195330 (7) : parsing [/etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg:116] : HTTP log/header format not usable with proxy 'nova_novncproxy' (needs 'mode http').
stderr F [WARNING] 121/195330 (7) : config : 'http-request' rules ignored for proxy 'nova_novncproxy' as they require HTTP mode.

Let's add mode http to avoid this which is used in most other services
anyways.

Change-Id: Ib3daf19ed7318a0a04349b62ea4c821e1d87e648
"}]
commit_message:
Use http mode for nova_novncproxy

Haproxy warns us with the following:
stderr F [WARNING] 121/195330 (7) : parsing [/etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg:116] : HTTP log/header format not usable with proxy 'nova_novncproxy' (needs 'mode http').
stderr F [WARNING] 121/195330 (7) : config : 'http-request' rules ignored for proxy 'nova_novncproxy' as they require HTTP mode.

Let's add mode http to avoid this which is used in most other services
anyways.

Change-Id: Ib3daf19ed7318a0a04349b62ea4c821e1d87e648

commit_message:
Specifies the appropriate ip address in case of multi-networking

When connecting a storage_network to VMs, the tests may try
to associate a FloatingIP to the storage network instead of the
project network.

Note: This failure has been caused since [1] was merged

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668597/

Change-Id: Ife32cb2616701a285cb16d5b267bdf6a78d74c3c

commit_message:
Check that ceph-mon service has started to get its version

Add an extra check to verify that ceph-mon service has started
before trying to retrieve its version.

An already existing function is being used, wait_for_daemon

Since we now guarantee that we are using systemctl, we can use
the is-active feature. If the service is running, the exit code
will be 0.

Also, change the command used to get the mon version. We can use
the ceph version command provided by the new cli instead of using
ceph daemon command which requires more privileges.

Change-Id: I2d4f23721107c4b5cb1c09719c55424eecd0c880
Closes-Bug: #1872855

commit_message:
Removes upstart support

Upstart is not being used anymore (last release was Sept 2014)
Doesn't make sense to keep bits for this

Make this plugin compatible only with distros with systemctl

Change-Id: I4fd533985d5bce3e0513c46558763629fb1539fc
Closes-Bug: #1874457

subject: Use more reliable way to get mysql version
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-04 13:34:34.000000000', 'message': 'Use more reliable way to get mysql version

mysqladmin --version displays version of client instead of server one.
So we should make decision to run mysql upgrade or not based
on the server version. Also this task should be ran only when mariadb
is already deployed.
This will make possible to be more independent from client version.

Change-Id: I41e2b57a78fac585d6ad71b6bcd606d4248111f6
'}]
commit_message:
Use more reliable way to get mysql version

mysqladmin --version displays version of client instead of server one.
So we should make decision to run mysql upgrade or not based
on the server version. Also this task should be ran only when mariadb
is already deployed.
This will make possible to be more independent from client version.

Change-Id: I41e2b57a78fac585d6ad71b6bcd606d4248111f6

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-27 11:48:57.000000000', 'message': "Fix py3 amphora-agent cert-rotation type bug

Flask's stream always returns bytes, file write always takes string.
This causes py3 amps to return 500 on cert rotation AND wipe out the
certificate, so the amphora are no longer controllable and go to ERROR
state. Anyone running py3 amps prior to this patch will experience
amphorae breaking on a timer due to housekeeping cert rotation!

Change-Id: I831b0b48d719397c14d80f8ebcbad997c50c7795
(cherry picked from commit 96a4482dff134b7be5c8d4da6c862b0a7f4a5a4b)
"}, {'created': '2020-04-29 11:39:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix py3 amphora-agent cert-rotation type bug

Flask's stream always returns bytes, file write always takes string.
This causes py3 amps to return 500 on cert rotation AND wipe out the
certificate, so the amphora are no longer controllable and go to ERROR
state. Anyone running py3 amps prior to this patch will experience
amphorae breaking on a timer due to housekeeping cert rotation!

Change-Id: I831b0b48d719397c14d80f8ebcbad997c50c7795
(cherry picked from commit 96a4482dff134b7be5c8d4da6c862b0a7f4a5a4b)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix py3 amphora-agent cert-rotation type bug

Flask's stream always returns bytes, file write always takes string.
This causes py3 amps to return 500 on cert rotation AND wipe out the
certificate, so the amphora are no longer controllable and go to ERROR
state. Anyone running py3 amps prior to this patch will experience
amphorae breaking on a timer due to housekeeping cert rotation!

Change-Id: I831b0b48d719397c14d80f8ebcbad997c50c7795
(cherry picked from commit 96a4482dff134b7be5c8d4da6c862b0a7f4a5a4b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-13 14:48:08.000000000', 'message': "Py2 - Remove six and mock

Since we've dropped support for Python 2.7, it's time to look at
the bright future that Python 3.x will bring and stop forcing
compatibility with older versions.

commit_message:
Py2 - Remove six, mock and future

Since we've dropped support for Python 2.7, it's time to look at
the bright future that Python 3.x will bring and stop forcing
compatibility with older versions.

This patch removes the six library , switches the mock library
to unittest.mock and removes future.

Change-Id: I71b11f13691d13df162b203f7ea5979b30c272df

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia89c2a6490da4fb271d3eac97e067664903e8a92

subject: os_server_action: pass imageRef to rebuild
messages:
[{'account_id': 16211, 'date': '2020-04-29 20:56:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-04-29 21:26:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2020-05-02 12:17:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Seems like it should raise an exception? https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/commit/3a0e5f985fdd4b067d68450360cf62d57e82ecb2/nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#L1054-L1055

Can we have test for that?'}, {'account_id': 16211, 'date': '2020-05-04 16:43:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I wrote a small standalone script and verified that the following call to post() does return a "Response [400]".

  url = '/servers/%s/action' % server_id
  result = cloud.compute.post(url, json={'rebuild': None})

With my change here to add imageRef, post() returns a "Response [202]" instead.

I guess the bigger problem is that we never check the HTTP return code of any of these post() calls.

How would you like to proceed?'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2020-05-04 17:42:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I see.. Actually I have a patch that adds tests for server action, so I'll add rebuild test there as well: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/721746
I think we can proceed with that, thanks for the fix!"}, {'account_id': 16211, 'date': '2020-05-04 17:50:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-29 20:56:50.000000000', 'message': 'os_server_action: pass imageRef to rebuild

Prior to this change, the os_server_action module could not rebuild
servers, because it passed no arguments to the "rebuild" object.

The imageRef parameter is mandatory. If the client does not specify
imageRef, Nova takes no action to rebuild the server.

Change-Id: I0edbdb634feb90d4c54476a4089fcb014c0b83b2
'}]
commit_message:
os_server_action: pass imageRef to rebuild

Prior to this change, the os_server_action module could not rebuild
servers, because it passed no arguments to the "rebuild" object.

The imageRef parameter is mandatory. If the client does not specify
imageRef, Nova takes no action to rebuild the server.

Change-Id: I0edbdb634feb90d4c54476a4089fcb014c0b83b2

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7.3 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Switch to hacking 3.0, ignore W503 and W504 (as in cinder repo)
- Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS instead of obsolete UPPER_CONSTRAINTS

Change-Id: Ia623c8af7f03c25bce7e4600693a7e834ab70000

messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-24 15:35:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-04-29 10:14:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27224, 'date': '2020-05-04 17:32:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nLGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-24 15:35:15.000000000', 'message': 'Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I3f05b92adc97ca150157fff0be8649e97f89db99
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I3f05b92adc97ca150157fff0be8649e97f89db99
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Throw an exception in case of exceeding quota.

Sometimes we create a lot of security group rules, which might exceed
the quotas. In this patch we propose to distinguish conflict exceptions
for quota exceeding from rule already exists.

Change-Id: Icea686ec9d1fcb701f1853c40d6cfd4ca20fd0ac

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-03 22:34:26.000000000', 'message': "Fix unsubscriptable-object error

After astroid upgrade from 2.3.3 to 2.4.0, we hit
unsubscriptable-object error:
neutron_vpnaas/db/vpn/vpn_db.py:197:
E1136: 'ipsec_site_conn_db' is unsubscriptable
neutron_vpnaas/db/vpn/vpn_db.py:622:
E1136: Value 'endpoint_group_db' is unsubscriptable

Use db attribute while vpn_models not define _getitem__()
for getting object values.

Change-Id: If0b83c693eedba5eb11dcda7abe07f51e4539516
(cherry picked from commit 3e1828e07e151022019c71f1c5403c2fdd0b0b30)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix unsubscriptable-object error

After astroid upgrade from 2.3.3 to 2.4.0, we hit
unsubscriptable-object error:
neutron_vpnaas/db/vpn/vpn_db.py:197:
E1136: 'ipsec_site_conn_db' is unsubscriptable
neutron_vpnaas/db/vpn/vpn_db.py:622:
E1136: Value 'endpoint_group_db' is unsubscriptable

Use db attribute while vpn_models not define _getitem__()
for getting object values.

Change-Id: If0b83c693eedba5eb11dcda7abe07f51e4539516
(cherry picked from commit 3e1828e07e151022019c71f1c5403c2fdd0b0b30)

commit_message:
Fail gracefully when MD5 is unavailable

The glanceclient currently assumes that MD5 will always be available.
This is not the case, however, in a FIPS-compliant environment.  This
patch enables the glanceclient to fail gracefully in such a case.

Closes-bug: #1871675
Change-Id: Ibd89989e06cc5be7da71f5f21561d73b5abc4104

commit_message:
Add py38 package metadata

Now that we are running the Victoria tests that include a
voting py38, we can now add the Python 3.8 metadata to the
package information to reflect that support.

Change-Id: I2053adc65b86e6616c3998a3c8d3143a1d0dd28f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Update deps list for building ipxe-boot.qcow2
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-04 15:05:57.000000000', 'message': "Update deps list for building ipxe-boot.qcow2

Perl is not required, so it's removed from the list. Package
syslinux-nonlinux is added to the list because when it's missing, the
build suffers this non-fatal error:

    genisoimage: Uh oh, I cant find the boot image 'isolinux.bin' !

Also, the list is now sorted alphabetically :).

Change-Id: Ib52365e5e962adc471bef0fd8a1a2d536ee8d835
"}, {'created': '2020-05-04 15:22:24.000000000', 'message': "Update deps list for building ipxe-boot.qcow2

Perl is not required, so it's removed from the list. Package
syslinux-nonlinux is added to the list because when it's missing, the
build suffers this non-fatal error:

    genisoimage: Uh oh, I cant find the boot image 'isolinux.bin' !

Also, the list is now sorted alphabetically :).

Change-Id: Ib52365e5e962adc471bef0fd8a1a2d536ee8d835
"}]
commit_message:
Update deps list for building ipxe-boot.qcow2

Perl is not required, so it's removed from the list. Package
syslinux-nonlinux is added to the list because when it's missing, the
build suffers this non-fatal error:

    genisoimage: Uh oh, I cant find the boot image 'isolinux.bin' !

Also, the list is now sorted alphabetically :).

Change-Id: Ib52365e5e962adc471bef0fd8a1a2d536ee8d835

Drop CentOS 7 jobs

Python 2 is no longer supported, and therefore neither is CentOS 7.

commit_message:
Switch to unittest mock

Python3 have a standard library for mock in the unittest module,
let's drop the mock requirement and switch tests to unittest mock.

Change-Id: I4f1b3e25c8adbc24cdda51c73da3b66967f7ef23

Still adding new stuff, like not failing on transient error connecting to the sub-man.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2020-04-21 16:16:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2020-04-21 16:20:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

During testing I encounter temporary network error with subscription-manager, and I didn't want the update to fail on such thing, so I added some more retry logic here.

I've tested it like this:

Original msg:

     super().connect()
     File "/usr/lib64/python3.6/http/client.py", line 946, in connect
     (self.host,self.port), self.timeout, self.source_address)
     File "/usr/lib64/python3.6/socket.py", line 724, in create_connection
     raise err
     File "/usr/lib64/python3.6/socket.py", line 713, in create_connection
     sock.connect(sa)
     ConnectionRefusedError: [Errno 111] Connection refused

so I did a special python file which raise the error at the same point:

     [stack@undercloud-0 undercloud-ansible-9v3q7lyz]$ sudo diff -ruN /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/rhsm/connection.py.network-error  /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/rhsm/connection.py
     --- /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/rhsm/connection.py.network-error 2020-04-21 15:17:00.460560018 +0000
     +++ /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/rhsm/connection.py       2020-04-21 15:53:19.700232734 +0000
     @@ -581,7 +581,6 @@

     try:
     conn.request(request_type, handler, body=body, headers=final_headers)
     -            raise ConnectionRefusedError
     except ssl.SSLError:
     if self.cert_file:
     id_cert = certificate.create_from_file(self.cert_file)

and before starting:

sudo cp /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/rhsm/connection.py.network-error  /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/rhsm/connection.py

then during ansible retry:

sudo cp /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/rhsm/connection.py.orig  /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/rhsm/connection.py

This worked in every combination I tried of non-susbscribed, subscribed, subscribed to the wrong subscription.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2020-04-21 16:20:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> I feel like the role name could be "tripleo_redhat_version_check"?
 > if that's all it's doing.

There will be more check later, like "are all the eus stream correctly configured"'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2020-04-21 16:43:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2020-04-21 22:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-20 15:57:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add a check for correct OSP/RedHat pair.

Change-Id: I2d1ac92ee6ee8407fb156a2718f94ad3e9220bbe
'}, {'created': '2020-04-20 17:34:16.000000000', 'message': 'Add a check for correct OSP/RedHat pair.

Change-Id: I2d1ac92ee6ee8407fb156a2718f94ad3e9220bbe
'}, {'created': '2020-04-20 22:14:49.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo_redhat_enforce new role to enforce OSP/RHEL pair.

OSP, the downstream version of tripleo have to enforce some policies
for rhel version and subscribed channel.

This module hosts thoses requirements, so that we prevent update to
wrong rhel release or subscription to wrong channels.

Currently it only implements a basic check to the subscribed rhel
version.

We are avoiding the validation framework as this can be easily
disabled and we want this enforcement to be mandatory as this could
lead user to unsupported combinaison of OSP/RHEL.

For upstream that change is transparent as the tasks are skipped if
the ansible_distribution is not Red Hat.

For Red Hat, there will be a mechanism in THT to avoid the check
altogether, for instance for CI purposes.

For this first check (release/OSP), downstream patches will add the
required values in vars/redhat.yml.

Change-Id: I2d1ac92ee6ee8407fb156a2718f94ad3e9220bbe

This module hosts thoses requirements, so that we prevent update to

temporary network issue when running subscription-manager.

We are avoiding the validation framework as this can be easily

For upstream that change is transparent as the tasks are skipped if

altogether, for instance for CI purposes.

the required values in vars/redhat.yml.

For upstream that change is transparent as the tasks are skipped if
the ansible_distribution is not Red Hat.

For Red Hat, there will be a mechanism in THT to avoid the check
altogether, for instance for CI purposes.

For this first check (RHEL/OSP version), downstream patches will add
the required values in vars/redhat.yml.

Change-Id: I2d1ac92ee6ee8407fb156a2718f94ad3e9220bbe
'}]
commit_message:
tripleo_redhat_enforce new role to enforce RHOSP constraints.

OSP, the downstream version of tripleo have to enforce some policies
for rhel version and subscribed channel.

This module hosts hoses requirements, so that we prevent update to
wrong rhel release or subscription to wrong channels.

Currently it only implements a basic check to the subscribed rhel
version.

This check has some fail-safe logic to avoid crashing the update on
temporary network issue when running subscription-manager.

We are avoiding the validation framework as this can be easily
disabled and we want this enforcement to be mandatory as this could
lead user to unsupported combination of OSP/RHEL.

For upstream that change is transparent as the tasks are skipped if
the ansible_distribution is not Red Hat.

For Red Hat, there will be a mechanism in THT to avoid the check
altogether, for instance for CI purposes.

For this first check (RHEL/OSP version), downstream patches will add
the required values in vars/redhat.yml.

Change-Id: I2d1ac92ee6ee8407fb156a2718f94ad3e9220bbe

Use anchor to require necessary packages

... so that correct packages are required according without re-defining
them in resource implementations.

commit_message:
Add tripleo_delegate_to var for ceph health validation

According to the tripleo-validation change, we're just
moving from the default ansible delegate_to to the
tripleo_delegate_to directive provided by TripleO.
This ensure the task is executed using the overcloud
facts, fixing the upgrade (from queens) scenario.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/718011
Closes-Bug: #1871380
Change-Id: I08e44544e1069c5fd1b2d9832c6778ff32427369

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-07 09:49:27.000000000', 'message': "Introducing tripleo_delegate_to on ceph health validation

The purpose of this change is to fix the upgrade scenario
without breaking the existing validation for the
deployment phase.  During the upgrade from queens, the
default 'container_cli' is podman in the undercloud (which
is updated), but it's still docker in the overcloud and this
let the validation playbook to fail because we're computing
this fact starting from inventory_hostname that still points
to the undercloud.  This issue can be solved by removing the
delegation directive from tht and rely on tripleo delegate
wrapper.
This should be enough to access the overcloud (ceph_mon)
variables, setting the right fact.
This patch also fixes the jq filter to properly compute the
osd percentage starting from ceph osd stat output.

Change-Id: I46c4fbe0ef7b281d77bff82483eb0b48b4570bb3
"}, {'created': '2020-04-07 12:34:09.000000000', 'message': "Introducing tripleo_delegate_to on ceph health validation

wrapper.
This should be enough to access the overcloud (ceph_mon)

This patch also fixes the jq filter to properly compute the

commit_message:
Introducing tripleo_delegate_to on ceph health validation

The purpose of this change is to fix the upgrade scenario
without breaking the existing validation for the
deployment phase.  During the upgrade from queens, the
default 'container_cli' is podman in the undercloud (which
is updated), but it's still docker in the overcloud and this
let the validation playbook to fail because we're computing
this fact starting from inventory_hostname that still points
to the undercloud.  This issue can be solved by removing the
delegation directive from tht and rely on tripleo delegate
wrapper.
This should be enough to access the overcloud (ceph_mon)
variables, setting the right fact.

Closes-Bug: #1871380
Change-Id: I46c4fbe0ef7b281d77bff82483eb0b48b4570bb3

[{'created': '2020-04-24 15:33:22.000000000', 'message': 'Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Ie26a8d5a79c3ba8348419f031af0cef0f0e5c6c7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Ie26a8d5a79c3ba8348419f031af0cef0f0e5c6c7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add Octavia file in devstack/lib

Looks like this was initially missed on the OVN migration,
but after talking with Octavia, this setup should really
all live here since it's SDN-specific things that are
being configured.

Content basically copied from the octavia devstack/plugin.sh
script with some small modifications to support OVN.

Change-Id: Idb80cd164c6b41ca6636373696a9a1e7f19b5e62

commit_message:
Updates for python3.8

With the move to the Victoria job template in
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722681/, the py37 jobs no
longer get run, so the check and gate job entries can
be removed.

Added a keepalived py38 KillFilter line to match the py36
and py37 ones.

Also updated TESTING.rst to use py38 in all examples.

Change-Id: Ief793b54d53c3239cfb24278e88e4f4189bbc2c2

'}, {'created': '2020-05-04 15:07:51.000000000', 'message': 'Undo renaming member to Member role in devstack plugin install

This was done for legacy reasons when Keystone v2 used Member role
instead, but we should not do this and keep member for easier debugging
and because member is what Keystone supports now anyway:

https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/admin/service-api-protection.html

Change-Id: I4387c6d96d9f6b5eab2f1fc3ee766465832c1b6d

commit_message:
Undo renaming member to Member role in devstack plugin install

This was done for legacy reasons when Keystone v2 used Member role
instead, but we should not do this and keep member for easier debugging
and because member is what Keystone supports now anyway:

https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/admin/service-api-protection.html

Change-Id: I4387c6d96d9f6b5eab2f1fc3ee766465832c1b6d

commit_message:
Apply OSD settings from mons.

Apply OSD settings requested by the mons via the juju relation.
Add the OSD settings to config too. Before applying the settings
config-flags is checked to ensure there is no overlap.

Change-Id: Id69222217a1c99d0269831913abdf488791cb572

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-04 01:25:41.000000000', 'message': "Switch the grenade-py3 job to new zuulv3 grenade job name

'grenade' is zuulv3 native job for py3 (because devstack is default to
py3 since Ussuri) which replace the old 'grenade-py3'
legacy job. 'grenade-py3' job is alias to the new zuulv3 native
'grenade' job but that is only for migration time. Later once
all projects switch to new job name, we will remove the 'grenade-py3'
alias job.

ML: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014602.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/725148/
Change-Id: I1ca26e20ea2badde1a2d3914cef96a3afb9dda19
"}]
commit_message:
Switch the grenade-py3 job to new zuulv3 grenade job name

'grenade' is zuulv3 native job for py3 (because devstack is default to
py3 since Ussuri) which replace the old 'grenade-py3'
legacy job. 'grenade-py3' job is alias to the new zuulv3 native
'grenade' job but that is only for migration time. Later once
all projects switch to new job name, we will remove the 'grenade-py3'
alias job.

ML: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014602.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/725148/
Change-Id: I1ca26e20ea2badde1a2d3914cef96a3afb9dda19

commit_message:
Fix nits from RBD volume migration changes

This addresses some minor issues in
I01039b7651a354761d034a9118b55b96cf32445e

Change-Id: I98dbc1f843a99405f12b6b9d1d189e27f5cdce6c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Allow specifying config key in call to configure_source
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-04 12:51:57.000000000', 'message': 'Allow specifying config key in call to configure_source

A charm may be in need of adding multiple sources (for
example vendor specific PPAs), and it would be useful
if the ``configure_source`` method would allow to do
this.

In such a use case overriding the ``source_config_key``
class variable would not be practical, so we allow
to optionally specify it as a argument to the method.

commit_message:
Allow specifying config key in call to configure_source

A charm may be in need of adding multiple sources (for
example vendor specific PPAs), and it would be useful
if the ``configure_source`` method would allow to do
this.

In such a use case overriding the ``source_config_key``
class variable would not be practical, so we allow
to optionally specify it as a argument to the method.

Change-Id: Ia5a8f05e863251520771a1c01a5f7dddf4be34d0
Closes-Bug: #1876720

subject: Add login and package monitoring to auditbeat
messages: [{'account_id': 31004, 'date': '2020-05-04 13:16:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-05-04 13:25:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-05-04 14:03:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-04 13:16:39.000000000', 'message': 'Add login and package monitoring to auditbeat

The auditbeat deployment currently misses two system data sets that
it supports: login and package. The login dataset collects user login,
logout and system boot data, whereas the package dataset monitors the
installed packages on the system. This commit enables both datasets,
so Auditbeat now collects the maximum amount of system data.

Change-Id: Ib071db1f179cee7148cd54ee945f89f9e226fe16
'}]
commit_message:
Add login and package monitoring to auditbeat

The auditbeat deployment currently misses two system data sets that
it supports: login and package. The login dataset collects user login,
logout and system boot data, whereas the package dataset monitors the
installed packages on the system. This commit enables both datasets,
so Auditbeat now collects the maximum amount of system data.

Change-Id: Ib071db1f179cee7148cd54ee945f89f9e226fe16

commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I79f91718979d161f64d949812e1904fceb67776d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-03-24 18:15:32.000000000', 'message': 'Use dict .get() to avoid a KeyError in the segment plugin

On subnet delete, the supplied subnet in the post hook
could contain a subnet without certain items, leading to
a KeyError in the segment plugin.  Fix a number of these
occurences so this cannot happen.

Also fixed similar code in the segment tests.

Change-Id: I645610febde446b78ed6edd868e699673648a4de
Closes-bug: #1868724
'}]
commit_message:
Use dict .get() to avoid a KeyError in the segment plugin

On subnet delete, the supplied subnet in the post hook
could contain a subnet without certain items, leading to
a KeyError in the segment plugin.  Fix a number of these
occurences so this cannot happen.

Also fixed similar code in the segment tests.

Change-Id: I645610febde446b78ed6edd868e699673648a4de
Closes-bug: #1868724

commit_message:
Stop using six library

Since we've dropped support for Python 2.7, it's time to look at
the bright future that Python 3.x will bring and stop forcing
compatibility with older versions.
This patch removes the six library from requirements, not
looking back.

Change-Id: I3674fcff935e0f260877d2142e6706d5f9c135a8

commit_message:
Replace deprecated drivers parameter by disabled_drivers

The [DEFAULT]drivers parameter was already deprecated in favor of the
new parameter, [DEFAULT]disabled_drivers [1].
This patch replaces the parameter in puppet-congress accordingly.

[1] 82a708abcf72892c0864c9beef1c412cf3b23194

Change-Id: I77bb6e64b6bae7811be73d4a1615764095dcf0cd

commit_message:
Pin sh library used for molecule tests

This pin works for python2 and python3 environments
and resolves:

https://github.com/ansible-community/molecule/issues/2676

We unfortunately have molecule pinned, so we won't
inherit any fixes (including this one) from newer
releases.

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Switch to using sphinx-build
- Use newer openstackdocstheme and Sphinx versions
- Cleanup */source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Fix problems found by sphinx-build

Change-Id: I258ba61fb3c2c5e83e71109dab941e304dde3f76

commit_message:
CI: Temporary disable grenade job for Ussuri release

Temporarily removing the grenade job to enable the final
Ussuri release related patch to merge, as underlying grenade
logic has apparently changed.

Change-Id: If9ff338add6d71a3f48648f4a8f5ba9fe987d2a4

Add Python3 victoria unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for victoria.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Switch to using sphinx-build
- Use newer openstackdocstheme and Sphinx versions
- Cleanup */source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Remove Babel from requirements, it's not needed for running.

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Switch to using sphinx-build
- Use newer openstackdocstheme and Sphinx versions
- Cleanup */source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.

Change-Id: Icab2b68608002968bbc56791faedd119db7516e7

commit_message:
rabbitmq: update cluster version on reconfigure

This fixes https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1731142. The
solution is to bump a version number of the cluster configuration
file (/etc/kolla/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-clusterer.config) every time
RabbitMQ configuration files change.

Closes-bug: #1731142
Change-Id: I26cce92e52b2ba6b905658e11d794c65e361f545
(cherry picked from commit 7408d499799e4d3a043f5e5ebf5f61c206bc0d2e)

'}]
commit_message:
Allow using uwsgi when using Debian packages.

Change-Id: I499f8b7af5f636798dcf9c29c8e46db60f7cf1ce

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-04 11:05:28.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for snapshots from ceph

The data-mover service requires direct access to the ceph cluster
in order to snapshot volumes etc.

Add support for the ceph-client interface; configuration and keyring
are writen to a charm specific location to avoid interference with
any other ceph services that may be deployed in the same unit.

TrilioVault requires some slight specialised ceph keyring and conf
placement - see code for notes.

Change-Id: If6998d668fc3e7bd164069ba01a157e136133706
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for snapshots from ceph

The data-mover service requires direct access to the ceph cluster
in order to snapshot volumes etc.

Add support for the ceph-client interface; configuration and keyring
are writen to a charm specific location to avoid interference with
any other ceph services that may be deployed in the same unit.

TrilioVault requires some slight specialised ceph keyring and conf
placement - see code for notes.

Change-Id: If6998d668fc3e7bd164069ba01a157e136133706

Hello Thomas, please change it anyway for consistency and if there is ever any other operating systems added.'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2019-03-09 16:42:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm sorry to say it this way, but this is silly. There's absolutely no reason to add a variable in this case, especially if you consider that Ubuntu has moved to Python 3 as well. In other modules, I did add such a variable because we needed to handle the Ubuntu case. This time, Ubuntu doesn't do the cloudkitty-dashboard package at all, and therefore, it's the exact same package as the one in Debian.

Tobias, could you reconsider?"}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-05-04 11:30:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-01 07:37:29.000000000', 'message': "pysnmp's cmdgen module has moved

It looks like in pysnmp latest release, the cmdgen module has changed
path. This patch allows to use both path, so that Ceilometer continues
working in both Debian Sid and Stretch. FYI, here's related Debian bug
about this: https://bugs.debian.org/909985

Change-Id: I63312ad9a9440304c90821d97b0a34fc5fc349ce
"}]
commit_message:
pysnmp's cmdgen module has moved

It looks like in pysnmp latest release, the cmdgen module has changed
path. This patch allows to use both path, so that Ceilometer continues
working in both Debian Sid and Stretch. FYI, here's related Debian bug
about this: https://bugs.debian.org/909985

Change-Id: I63312ad9a9440304c90821d97b0a34fc5fc349ce

commit_message:
Pass on osd settings from clients to osd units

If a client application has requested particular osd settings then
validate them and pass them on to the osd units.

commit_message:
Remove apt-cacher-ng cleanup tasks

The apt-cache was removed a long time ago and these tasks should
already have been removed in the Train release. Remove them now.
There is no change for existing deployments as these tasks are no
longer required as the apt-cache component of the repo server is already
retired.

Change-Id: I42785ee153955eb6e72bef01c26791ae8eec2087

commit_message:
Remove git deamon functionality

Caching git repositories has been deprecated in Queens, so it's high time
we removed this functionality.
This shouldn't influece OSA deployments in any way.

Change-Id: I35829aa35489f06dbb3b65f522f0a08318eccbfa

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-24 18:19:16.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I33e1714f296b41a806e5fcdd87f38b8cbe9e904f
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I33e1714f296b41a806e5fcdd87f38b8cbe9e904f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-01 20:25:37.000000000', 'message': 'Transform shell/ls task to use "find" module

The Ansible way to list files which match a certain parttern is to use
the find module:

https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/modules/find_module.html

Also adding a comment that the task isn't useful for now, and modify a
comment which recommends to use with_items (deprecated) while a loop
should be used with newer Ansible.

Change-Id: I67e55857d7d510d96319ee767473c11942b79239
'}]
commit_message:
Transform shell/ls task to use "find" module

The Ansible way to list files which match a certain parttern is to use
the find module:

https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/modules/find_module.html

Also adding a comment that the task isn't useful for now, and modify a
comment which recommends to use with_items (deprecated) while a loop
should be used with newer Ansible.

Change-Id: I67e55857d7d510d96319ee767473c11942b79239

[{'created': '2020-05-03 09:55:58.000000000', 'message': "Update docs building, cleanup

Update docs building and cleanup:
* Switch to sphinx-build
* Update requirements for Sphinx and openstackdocstheme for
  python 3, remove oslosphinx which is dead, create
  doc/requirements.txt file
* Remove unneeded doc and translation sections from setup.cfg
* Remove install_command, it's unneeded, the default is fine.
* Move constraints into deps, use TOX_CONSTRAINTS instead of obsolete
  UPPER_CONSTRAINTS
* Switch to hacking 3.0, fix problems found

Change-Id: If3c5094d7fbdc9033851024c8e3ae364e4768521
"}]
commit_message:
Update docs building, cleanup

Update docs building and cleanup:
* Switch to sphinx-build
* Update requirements for Sphinx and openstackdocstheme for
  python 3, remove oslosphinx which is dead, create
  doc/requirements.txt file
* Remove unneeded doc and translation sections from setup.cfg
* Remove install_command, it's unneeded, the default is fine.
* Move constraints into deps, use TOX_CONSTRAINTS instead of obsolete
  UPPER_CONSTRAINTS
* Switch to hacking 3.0, fix problems found

Change-Id: If3c5094d7fbdc9033851024c8e3ae364e4768521

Fix ovn gate

The repo networking-ovn moved to ovn-octavia-provider. We should
move the CI to install OVN from the Neutron repo.

(cherry picked from commit c77a38f8a11046c9cff2c4d395610fad264d2e0f)

commit_message:
Fix ovn gate

The repo networking-ovn moved to ovn-octavia-provider. We should
move the CI to install OVN from the Neutron repo.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717860/
Change-Id: I82678cf52bf5d3f7594c33f5ca032983cdbdc326

commit_message:
Deprecation note for devicemapper and overlay

The devicemapper and overlay storage driver are deprecated in
favor of overlay2 in docker, and will be removed in a future
release from docker. Users of the devicemapper and overlay
storage driver are recommended to migrate to a different
storage driver, such as overlay2. overlay2 will be set as
the default storage driver from Victoria cycle.

Task: 39526
Story: 2005201

Change-Id: Idfd784dc3f1bfbe6bce5671bc5a1ef69d82636b1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-21 15:50:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix queries to retrieve allocations with network_segment_range

Fixed the queries to retrieve the segment ID allocations when service
plugin network_segment_range is enabled. With the previous
implementation, a project user was able to allocate a segment ID
belonging to other project segment range.

The solution implemented was discussed in [1]:
- A project user will retrieve segments from the project ranges.
- When depleted, the segment IDs will be retrieved from the shared
  range, never using another project segment ID.

[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-February/012736.html

Conflicts:
      neutron/common/_constants.py
      neutron/objects/plugins/ml2/vlanallocation.py
      neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_network_segment_range.py

Change-Id: I953062d9ee8ee5ee9a9f07aff4a8222ac63ed525
Closes-Bug: #1863423
(cherry picked from commit 046672247de56bad950e8267a57bd26205f354a0)
(cherry picked from commit bbe401aaf9bfdd77e1d43d547b2cdb436b1440c8)

commit_message:
Fix queries to retrieve allocations with network_segment_range

Fixed the queries to retrieve the segment ID allocations when service
plugin network_segment_range is enabled. With the previous
implementation, a project user was able to allocate a segment ID
belonging to other project segment range.

The solution implemented was discussed in [1]:
- A project user will retrieve segments from the project ranges.
- When depleted, the segment IDs will be retrieved from the shared
  range, never using another project segment ID.

[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-February/012736.html

Conflicts:
      neutron/objects/network_segment_range.py
      neutron/objects/plugins/ml2/base.py
      neutron/objects/plugins/ml2/vxlanallocation.py
      neutron/objects/plugins/ml2/vlanallocation.py
      neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_network_segment_range.py

Change-Id: I953062d9ee8ee5ee9a9f07aff4a8222ac63ed525
Closes-Bug: #1863423

[{'created': '2020-04-28 14:57:02.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0991f7b2fbe13753740e5aa26b39ed7ba42618dd

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-03 09:22:53.000000000', 'message': "Update docs building

Update docs building:
* Switch to sphinx-build
* Update requirements for Sphinx and openstackdocstheme for
  python 3, create doc/requirements.txt file.
* Remove unneeded doc and translation sections from setup.cfg
* Remove install_command, it's unneeded, the default is fine.
* Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS instead of obsolete UPPER_CONSTRAINTS

Change-Id: I6ff4427014fc967a6f7b28fc6cbe5a0f4eca601c
"}]
commit_message:
Update docs building

Update docs building:
* Switch to sphinx-build
* Update requirements for Sphinx and openstackdocstheme for
  python 3, create doc/requirements.txt file.
* Remove unneeded doc and translation sections from setup.cfg
* Remove install_command, it's unneeded, the default is fine.
* Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS instead of obsolete UPPER_CONSTRAINTS

Change-Id: I6ff4427014fc967a6f7b28fc6cbe5a0f4eca601c

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Sem-Ver: feature

'grenade-py3' is switched to new grenade zuulv3 native job,
we need to switch integrated-gate-py3 template to use the new
job name so that projects using this template can start
running the new job.

Details:
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014602.html

Change-Id: I333e8e066c6e225569b21e2450ccbaa2e588c232

commit_message:
Switch integrated-gate-py3 template to use new grenade job

'grenade-py3' is switched to new grenade zuulv3 native job,
we need to switch integrated-gate-py3 template to use the new
job name so that projects using this template can start
running the new job.

Details:
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014602.html

Change-Id: I333e8e066c6e225569b21e2450ccbaa2e588c232

commit_message:
Update the tox minversion parameter.

Update the minversion parameter to use the python -m pip to install
python packages:

commit_message:
Ensure NP are enforced on SVC with different port and target port

This patch ensure the proper listener id is found and its associated
security groups are updated.

commit_message:
Fix stack create verbosity

This change reverts the change to verbose_level because it enables
ansible verbosity by default. Additionally this change hard codes true
for the wait_for_stack_ready function call so we always get the heat
stack creation output.

Revert "Don't override default verbose_level"

This reverts commit c8cd7145884419a8da922d679f5d3e371c84bffa.

Change-Id: Idcc00fa04d4a356efb9e0bc30bc24e0121f31961

We've found that the systemd sidecars tend to drop events when spawning
multiple processes at once. Rather than continue to try and patch it, we

patches that were related to the systemd side car code.

commit_message:
Revert systemd sidecars

We've found that the systemd sidecars tend to drop events when spawning
multiple processes at once. Rather than continue to try and patch it, we
need to go back to the drawing board. This change reverts the various
patches that were related to the systemd side car code.

Revert "Use exec when spawning any neutron sidecar container"

This reverts commit 5b799136facc15d4e69bcede52b60d39a4a02464.

Revert "Remove neutron wrappers usage"

This reverts commit f4f3045c413e7da083dbd8495ef758c2ac86870d.

Revert "Use a systemd service to handle sidecar containers"

This reverts commit 2dc7066b050ecf22dc9e5909061272ffe765ebfc.

Change-Id: I8b9578b7c7d6bd23f0b677f64afae7be76ddcadf

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I715f658927bedc0c71aea8de6b684a018517d814

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-24 10:33:34.000000000', 'message': 'Workaround in NetworkSegmentRange OVO until "project_id" migration

The "network_segment_range" service plugin API does not have
"tenant_id" as parameter. However, because the migration from
"tenant_id" to "project_id" did not finish, every OVO with
"project_id" will also have "tenant_id" as an extra field. This
extra field will be populated with the same value as the
"project_id" field.

If the Neutron API WSGI is used and "tenant_id" is not present in
the API (defined in neutron-lib), both "tenant_id" and "project_id"
parameters will be removed from the response.

This patch introduces a workaround for this OVO until the migration
is over.

More information about this patch can be found in the bug c#4.

Change-Id: I85a02d8b59e8a758826c110e00df84672fa93676
Closes-Bug: #1828205
(cherry picked from commit 3053caaa02adaadfffa53fb1070aaa60f49419e8)
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround in NetworkSegmentRange OVO until "project_id" migration

The "network_segment_range" service plugin API does not have
"tenant_id" as parameter. However, because the migration from
"tenant_id" to "project_id" did not finish, every OVO with
"project_id" will also have "tenant_id" as an extra field. This
extra field will be populated with the same value as the
"project_id" field.

If the Neutron API WSGI is used and "tenant_id" is not present in
the API (defined in neutron-lib), both "tenant_id" and "project_id"
parameters will be removed from the response.

This patch introduces a workaround for this OVO until the migration
is over.

More information about this patch can be found in the bug c#4.

Change-Id: I85a02d8b59e8a758826c110e00df84672fa93676
Closes-Bug: #1828205
(cherry picked from commit 3053caaa02adaadfffa53fb1070aaa60f49419e8)

subject: Rename *_domain parameters to *_domain_name
messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-05-01 14:08:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-05-01 14:19:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-05-01 14:21:46.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from domain to domain-openrc'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-05-01 15:16:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-05-02 19:03:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-05-04 00:31:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-01 14:08:19.000000000', 'message': "Change default domain name from default to Default

... because 'Default' is now commonly used as domain name, while
'default' is used as domain id.

Change-Id: I4bce039248041ac2ccb74975cf8b97ea938efd67
"}, {'created': '2020-05-01 14:19:01.000000000', 'message': "Rename *_domain parameters to *_domain_name

... so that the parameter names clearly indicate that domain name
should be used instead of domain id.
This patch also change the default value of these domain parameters
from 'default' to 'Default', because now 'Default' is commonly used
as the name for default domain.

Change-Id: I4bce039248041ac2ccb74975cf8b97ea938efd67
"}, {'created': '2020-05-01 15:16:00.000000000', 'message': "Rename *_domain parameters to *_domain_name

... so that the parameter names clearly indicate that domain name
should be used instead of domain id.
This patch also change the default value of these domain parameters
from 'default' to 'Default', because now 'Default' is commonly used
as the name for default domain.

Change-Id: I4bce039248041ac2ccb74975cf8b97ea938efd67
"}]
commit_message:
Rename *_domain parameters to *_domain_name

... so that the parameter names clearly indicate that domain name
should be used instead of domain id.
This patch also change the default value of these domain parameters
from 'default' to 'Default', because now 'Default' is commonly used
as the name for default domain.

Change-Id: I4bce039248041ac2ccb74975cf8b97ea938efd67

commit_message:
Refactor RedfishVirtualMediaBoot

- Move staticmethods and classmethods to functions, since
in py36 we have a bug when ussing unittest.mock [1]
The only classmethod we are keeping is `_set_boot_device`
since it's used by `DracRedfishVirtualMediaBoot`

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue23078

Change-Id: I6e51bb956890a01535c62f8a378756e65d438ac3

commit_message:
Fix healthmanager not update amphora health when LB disable

When disable a loadbalancer have listener, the Heath Manager not update
amphora heath make it keep failover after heartbeat_timeout end time

Story: 2007587
Task: 39521

Change-Id: Ia6d3f40ae1b9b352492162513c9262748ee67e6f
(cherry picked from commit fe771a456d81b6600457b78210e21b88a3a9d83e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-17 09:17:44.000000000', 'message': "handle to get cyborg client exception when delete instance

When our cloud platform is not deployed or the Cyborg service is removed for
some reason, we should be able to delete the instance correctly.
Today, if there is no Cyborg service, or depolyed before and removed later,
if we want to cleanup the instance with 'accel:device_profile' in it's flavor
when the server build failed, or the user want to delete an older instance
contains 'accel:device_profile', that will be terminated the deleted if
we did not handle the exception.

Add unit test for handling the exception.

Closes-Bug: #1873387
Change-Id: I7ebb210eb4a7c80c7f2871f6805d97d65afdda9d
"}, {'created': '2020-04-17 10:11:06.000000000', 'message': "Handle to get cyborg client exception when delete instance

When our cloud platform is not deployed or the Cyborg service is removed for
some reason, we should be able to delete the instance correctly.
Today, if there is no Cyborg service, or depolyed before and removed later,
if we want to cleanup the instance with 'accel:device_profile' in it's flavor
when the server build failed, or the user want to delete an older instance
contains 'accel:device_profile', that will be terminated the deleted if
we did not handle the exception.

Add unit test for handling the exception.

Co-Authored-By: Brin Zhang <zhangbailin@inspur.com>

Closes-Bug: #1873387
Change-Id: I7ebb210eb4a7c80c7f2871f6805d97d65afdda9d
"}]
commit_message:
Handle to get cyborg client exception when delete instance

When our cloud platform is not deployed or the Cyborg service is removed for
some reason, we should be able to delete the instance correctly.
Today, if there is no Cyborg service, or depolyed before and removed later,
if we want to cleanup the instance with 'accel:device_profile' in it's flavor
when the server build failed, or the user want to delete an older instance
contains 'accel:device_profile', that will be terminated the deleted if
we did not handle the exception.

Add unit test for handling the exception.

Co-Authored-By: Brin Zhang <zhangbailin@inspur.com>

Closes-Bug: #1873387
Change-Id: I7ebb210eb4a7c80c7f2871f6805d97d65afdda9d

[{'created': '2020-04-27 18:51:11.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify the policy new defaults upgrade notes

There are cases where policy file is re-generated freshly
and end up having the new defaults only but expectation is that
old deprecated rule keep working.

If rule is present in policy file then, that has priority than
their defaults so either rule should not be present in policy file
or users needs to update their token to match the overridden rule
permission.

This issue was always present when any policy defaults were changed
with old defaults being supported as deprecated. This is we have
changed all the policy for new defaults so it came up as broken case.

Change-Id: Id9cd65877e53577bff22e408ca07bbeec4407f6e
Related-Bug: #1875418

commit_message:
Add nova-status upgrade check and reno for policy new defaults

There are cases where policy file is re-generated freshly
and end up having the new defaults only but expectation is that
old deprecated rule keep working.

If a rule is present in policy file then, that has priority over
its defaults so either rules should not be present in policy file
or users need to update their token to match the overridden rule
permission.

This issue was always present when any policy defaults were changed
with old defaults being supported as deprecated. This is we have
changed all the policy for new defaults so it came up as broken case.

Adding nova-status upgrade check also to detect such policy file.

Related-Bug: #1875418

Change-Id: Id9cd65877e53577bff22e408ca07bbeec4407f6e

[{'created': '2020-04-24 15:29:48.000000000', 'message': 'Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Ic9f2f0b044a8ab6e6974447dc2d710b3b328bf84
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Ic9f2f0b044a8ab6e6974447dc2d710b3b328bf84
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Move unit test code under tests/unit/

test.py was previously not in the tests
directory.  This means that downstream packagers
of Cinder have to specifically exclude it from
the main Cinder package (which does not typically
include unit tests).

Move it under the cinder/tests/unit/ dir where it
should be, to clean this up.

Change-Id: I65c50722f5990f540d84fa361b997302bbc935c5

commit_message:
Validate resource access when creating loadbalancer or member

* Make sure the user has access to the subnet in the request for
  creating or updating pool member.
* Make sure the user has access to port or subnet or network for
  creating load balancer

Story: 2007531
Task: 39339

Change-Id: I479019a911b5a1acfc1951d1cbbc2a351089cb4d
(cherry picked from commit a33d42fa59ada38dd5a5d3114a9a83f03a30d0b2)
